reviewText: I BOUGHT THIS DVD AND COMPARED IT TO THE USA RELEASE. THE PICTURE AND SOUND ARE A LITTLE BETTER, BUT THE DVD HAS BEEN EDITED. TWO SONGS HAVE BEEN REMOVED FROM FREEBIRD THE MOVIE AND THEN ADDED AS BONUS TRACKS. ALSO ABOUT 3 MINUTES OF INTERVIEW FOOTAGE HAS BEEN CUT OUT. THERE IS NO REASON FOR CUTTING OF THIS GREAT FOOTAGE.

reviewText: I've compared the US vs this release since folks were saying it was better and guess what the US version wins on both visual (a lot!) and sound (definitely better but not as big a delta as the visuals) for the movie - didn't care or check the reunion stuff.  It will only play in 1 of my 3 players.  The ONLY good thing about this is the menu access to the songs. IF the US version was too expensive or unavailable then this would be tolerable but visually and sonically inferior and edited to boot.  I regret spending the money.
Title: N/A

reviewText: First of all, this is a region 2 dvd, it will not play on region 1 (U.S.A.& Canada) dvd players. So, you'll need to get a Universal DVD Player, if you don't have one. It's easy to get one through Amazon, and its low priced. That's where I got mine, and I love it, especially for dvds just like this one. Now this DVD, its a GREAT IMPROVEMENT over the old "Artisan" dvd. You get better menus. You get separate menus for "Freebird the Movie" & "The Tribute Tour", so its no problem at all, to select which feature you want. Plus, you get more scene selections for both features, so its easier to select individual songs, and etc. on both features. Also this "new" version of "Freebird the Movie" has 5.1 surround sound."Freebird the Movie" Review: If you are not familiar with this, then I'll give you a little background information. This movie is somewhat of a documentary, that proceeds into full live performances of the "Original Lynyrd Skynyrd" Band at their peak. It includes most of their concert performance at the Knebworth Music Festival in England during 1976. This was an outdoor concert in front of a crowd of approximately 250,000 fans. It is simply awesome. Then you get some live performances in some other venues, and a grand finale performance of "Freebird" the song at "A Day on The Green" presented by Bill Graham, on the 4th of July, 1977 in Oakland, California.The line-up on "Freebird the Movie" includes:Ronnie Van Zant - Lead VocalsGary Rossington - Guitar, including slideAllen Collins - GuitarSteve Gaines - GuitarLeon Wilkeson - BassBilly Powell - PianoArtimus Pyle - DrumsBackground Vocals: (The Original Honkettes):Cassie GainesLesley HawkinsJo Jo BillingslyThe Song Set of "Freebird the Movie": (Note - The Songs may not necessarily be in this particular order):1.Workin' For MCA2.I Ain't the One3.Saturday Night Special4.Searching5.What's Your Name6.Whiskey Rock a Roller7.Travellin' Man (This one includes excellent slide guitar work by Gary Rossington)8.Gimme Three Steps9.Gimme Back My Bullets10.Cry For the Bad Man11.Call Me the Breeze12.T for Texas (This Lynyrd Skynyrd version is the best version, I've ever heard of this song. They put a lot of guitar work into it, and extend it out for about 10 minutes or so. It's Awesome!!!)13.Freebird (This performance is so good, that words just cannot describe it!!! This performance was filmed on the 4th of July, 1977 at Bill Graham's "A Day on The Green" in Oakland, California, before a packed, outdoor, enthusiastic crowd.)Then you get bonus songs as follows:14.Sweet Home Alabama15.That SmellThe movie ends with the band members boarding their plane, and shows them taking off. Then in Captions on the screen it mentions that their plane crashed on October 20, 1977, killing Ronnie Van Zant, Steve Gaines, Cassie Gaines, Dean Kilpatrick (road manager) and both pilots. It leaves you wondering "What might have been?"The "Tribute Tour of 1987":This feature is narrated by Charlie Daniels. The "Tribute Tour" feature is kinda like a documentary also, covering the history, & story of the band, it shows them on tour, traveling from city to city by bus. Then it proceeds into live performances, of some of the Lynyrd Skynryd classic songs. Charlie Daniels even joins in on one of the performances.Ronnie & Johnny's Daddy, Lacy Van Zant, is the Master of Ceremonies.The Band line-up includes:Johnny Van Zant - lead vocalsGary Rossington - guitarEd King - guitarRandall Hall - guitarLeon Wilkeson - bassArimus Pyle - drumsBilly Powell - keyboardsAllen Collins - creative consultantBack Up Singers:Dale Krantz RossingtonCarol BristowThey only do an instrumental of "Freebird", because at that time, Johnny says there was only one man that could sing that song on stage, and that was the late Ronnie. It's a great tribute tour!!!!Overall, this is a great dvd to have especially for any Skynyrd fan or Southern Rock Fan. I highly recommend it. Thanks!!!!
summary: Up-Dated (Australian) Version of "Freebird the Movie" & "The Tribute Tour" = Great Improvement, but it's Region 2!!!!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: ...that was distributed by Artisan Entertainment.IT has 2.0 audio, THIS has 5.1 for Free Bird The Movie.IT has a menu that's impossible to navigate, with about 4 scene selections.THIS has a scene selection for EACH AND EVERY SONG IN BOTH FILMS !!!Colors are brighter too.HIGHLY RECOMMEND if you have a region free player ( disc says region free, BUT color is PAL so it won't work on a region 1 player...I tried ).
